item.title: Taking the Linux Foundation Certified Kubernetes Administrator Exam As A Disabled Person
item.description: This post is intended to document aspects of taking the Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) exam as a disabled person. Specifically in my case, a visually impaired person. The hope is this will (a) make it easier for anyone in a similar situation and (b) help improve processes long-term for the disabled. Although the CKA is a Linux Foundation exam it is proctored through PSI. To be very clear: my interactions with individuals from both the Linux Foundation and PSI were extremely positive.
